Package frc.drive

Class DriveManagerStandard

java.lang.Object
frc.drive.AbstractDriveManager
frc.drive.DriveManagerStandard
All Implemented Interfaces:
ISubsystem
public class DriveManagerStandard
extends AbstractDriveManager
Everything that has to do with driving is in here. There are a lot of auxilairy helpers and Robot.robotSettings that feed in here.
See Also:
RobotTelemetryStandard

    • updateTeleop

      public void updateTeleop() throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      This is where driving happens. Call this every tick to drive and set DefaultConfig.DRIVE_STYLE to change the drive stype
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if DefaultConfig.DRIVE_STYLE is not implemented here or if you missed a break statement
      See Also:
      Robot.teleopPeriodic()

    • driveFPS

      public void driveFPS​(double leftFPS, double rightFPS)
      Drives the bot based on the requested left and right speed
      Parameters:
      leftFPS - Left drivetrain speed in feet per second
      rightFPS - Right drivetrain speed in feet per second

    • drive

      public void drive​(double forward, double rotation)
      drives the robot based on -1 / 1 inputs (ie 100% forward and 100% turning)
      Parameters:
      forward - the percentage of max forward to do
      rotation - the percentage of max turn speed to do

    • drivePercent

      public void drivePercent​(double leftPercent, double rightPercent)

    • drivePure

      public void drivePure​(double FPS, double omega)
      This takes a speed in feet per second, a requested turn speed in radians/sec
      Parameters:
      FPS - Speed in Feet per Second
      omega - Rotation in Radians per Second

    • driveMPS

      public void driveMPS​(double leftMPS, double rightMPS)
      Drives the bot based on the requested left and right speed
      Parameters:
      leftMPS - Left drivetrain speed in meters per second
      rightMPS - Right drivetrain speed in meters per second

    • createDriveMotors

      private void createDriveMotors() throws InitializationFailureException
      Creates the drive motors
      Throws:
      InitializationFailureException - When follower drive motors fail to link to leaders or when leader drivetrain motors fail to invert
